AdditionalFields.Value: Clinical Research Excluding Trials,Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics,Immunology

Description: Acute Leukemias are a challenging group of malignancies to treat due to their vast heterogeneity and high relapse rates in response to traditional chemotherapeutics. Despite therapeutic advances the survival rates in adults are extremely low with a 5 year survival of 27% and 50% for Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) and T cell Acute Lymphoid Leukemia (T-ALL) respectively. This session will explore alternate approaches to traditional chemotherapy including differentiation therapy, targeting apoptotic pathways, the immune microenvironment and the use of adoptive NK cell therapy.
SearchResultBody: AOS05. Alternative Strategies to Traditional Chemotherapy to Treat Acute Leukemia
Title: Alternative Strategies to Traditional Chemotherapy to Treat Acute Leukemia
